content: Does anyone have tips to make the lean infoview less cluttered with types that are no longer useful to the proof?

@Rafa M Munoz-Grenier Have you noticed the VS Code options 

    "lean4.infoview.showExpectedType": false,
    "lean4.infoview.emphasizeFirstGoal": true,
    "lean4.infoview.showGoalNames": false,

They declutter the infoview in slightly different ways than what you asked for. Regarding what you asked for, I think there is an ongoing discussion about which types/instances/hypotheses to show in the infoview (the Lean 3 behaviour was quite different) but I don't know the latest.
Heather, maybe you are answering a different question and Rafa does not know about the clear tactic.
I obsessively clear stuff in proofs, but that might be personal preference since it looks like mathlib proofs tend to not have clear >_>
This is precisely the case, I hadn't heard of the clear tactic
Rafa M Munoz-Grenier has marked this topic as resolved.
